First, one should not associate with evil companions; second, one should not associate with those who hold views; third, one should not associate with those who abandon all wholesome dharmas; fourth, one should not associate with those who delight in material gain.
One should not associate with these four kinds of people.
He further spoke a verse, saying:
If a person stays away from all evil friends, and always gets good friends to come close,
Like the full moon appearing in the sky, dispelling darkness and illuminating the path to enlightenment.
Always seeing without cutting off, biased nurturing of one's own body and life,
In this way, one can distance oneself from poisonous qi, and that person will attain the great wisdom of Buddhahood.
If one abandons the supreme subtle Dharma, and does not delight in the taste of the nectar of tranquility,
This is called an impure vessel, far removed from seeking to realize great enlightenment.
Seeking wealth, benefits, robes, and alms bowls, and also engaging in activities with laypeople,
In this way, one distances oneself from this pit of fire, and is able to accomplish the supreme path.

What are the four dharmas?
First, despising the Dharma; second, being attached to self and others; third, having no faith and understanding in one's mind; fourth, fully grasping and holding onto impure objects.
These four dharmas are dharmas of suffering retribution for bodhisattvas.
